title: Adding German keyboard definitions such as äöüß and using it in different programs
content:
Hi,

You downloaded a handwriting font from Dafont.com which didn't feature the German keyboard character layout, for example: °, §, ², ³, ä, ö, ü, ß, Ä, Ö, Ü, µ and € aren't included. However, you managed to insert the missing glyphs yourself by copying the period character.

The resulting font works just fine in Tux Paint. But it doesn't work in Word - the characters are missing, a good rectangle appears instead. What are you doing wrong?
author: 386sky

comments.content:
You edited I Hate Comic Sans, but preview text is:  
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz  
ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ  
1234567890  
~`'"!@#-$%^&\* ()?+€\<\>=:;{}  
§¨°²³ÄÖÜßäöü
